channel.title: 3D Printing Podcast
channel.itunes:subtitle: The Official Podcast of the the 3D Printing Industry. The 3d Printing Podcast has: news, information, opinions and interviews brought to you by the 3D Chamber. FInd us at http://3dchamber.com
channel.itunes:summary: Funny, quick, interesting insights into the 3d Printing Industry. The official podcast of the industry
channel.itunes:keywords: 3d, printing, additive, manufacturing, new, industry, CAD, drawing, home, based, manufacturing, disruptive
channel.itunes:author: bill decker

Enjoy the 3D Printing Podcast Featuring SME executives, Kevin Ayers, Industry Manager over Additive Manufacturing and 3D Technology and Jeannine Kunz, Managing Director, SME is a professional organization for individuals, students, educators and companies involved in manufacturing. item.content:encoded:
Enjoy the 3D Printing Podcast Featuring SME executives, Kevin Ayers, Industry Manager over Additive Manufacturing and 3D Technology and Jeannine Kunz, Managing Director, SME is a professional organization for individuals, students, educators and companies involved in manufacturing.

Is 3D Printing an educational opportunity? Is there a workforce problem created with 3D Printing?

SME is on top of this industry. It’s almost as though they read the 3D Printing Book

Gonzalo Martinez, Director of Strategic Research in the office of the CTO at Autodesk, gives an interesting interview about his firm’s play in 3D Printing. The significance of Autodesk is the fact that they are currently the largest company in the United States, and perhaps even the world that is
item.content:encoded:
Gonzalo Martinez, Director of Strategic Research in the office of the CTO at Autodesk, gives an interesting interview about his firm’s play in 3D Printing.

The significance of Autodesk is the fact that they are currently the largest company in the United States, and perhaps even the world that is producing a 3D printer. Gonzalo speaks about the firm, and his own family’s experience in 3D Printing!

From the Sols website: Our 100% digital process captures and stores a detailed foot scan before visualizing the product, and prescription, in real time. With
item.content:encoded:
3D Printing Podcast welcomes Kegan Schouwenburg, Founder of Sols in a fun interview. Kegan gives her views of the 3D Printing Industry as a whole. From the Sols website:

Our 100% digital process captures and stores a detailed foot scan before visualizing the product, and prescription, in real time. With SOLS, you will experience increased accuracy, improved comfort, and consistent quality. SOLS are made to order from ultra ﬂexible, anti-microbial nylon, & dyed the color of your choice.
item.itunes:subtitle: 3D Printing Podcast welcomes Kegan Schouwenburg, Founder of Sols in a fun interview. Kegan gives her views of the 3D Printing Industry as a whole. From the Sols website: Our 100% digital process captures and stores a detailed foot scan before visual[...]

With SOLS, you will experience increased accuracy, improved comfort, and consistent quality. SOLS are made to order from ultra ﬂexible, anti-microbial nylon, & dyed the color of your choice.

Enjoy the 3D Printing Podcast Featuring SME executives, Kevin Ayers, Industry Manager over Additive Manufacturing and 3D Technology and Jeannine Kunz, Managing Director, SME is a professional organization for individuals, students, educators and companies involved in all facets of manufacturing. Founded in 1932, SME is dedicated to advancing and educating
item.content:encoded:
Enjoy the 3D Printing Podcast Featuring SME executives, Kevin Ayers, Industry Manager over Additive Manufacturing and 3D Technology and Jeannine Kunz, Managing Director, SME is a professional organization for individuals, students, educators and companies involved in all facets of manufacturing. Founded in 1932, SME is dedicated to advancing and educating the manufacturing industry. Tooling U-SME, a division of SME, delivers versatile, competency-based learning and development solutions to the manufacturing community, working with more than half of all Fortune(r) 500 manufacturing companies, as well as educational institutions across the country.

SME is joining the 3D Printing Revolution!
item.itunes:subtitle: Enjoy the 3D Printing Podcast Featuring SME executives, Kevin Ayers, Industry Manager over Additive Manufacturing and 3D Technology and Jeannine Kunz, Managing Director, SME is a professional organization for individuals, students, educators and com[...]
item.itunes:summary: Enjoy the 3D Printing Podcast Featuring SME executives, Kevin Ayers, Industry Manager over Additive Manufacturing and 3D Technology and Jeannine Kunz, Managing Director, SME is a professional organization for individuals, students, educators and companies involved in all facets of manufacturing. Founded in 1932, SME is dedicated to advancing and educating the manufacturing industry. Tooling U-SME, a division of SME, delivers versatile, competency-based learning and development solutions to the manufacturing community, working with more than half of all Fortune(r) 500 manufacturing companies, as well as educational institutions across the country. SME is joining the 3D Printing Revolution!
item.itunes:author: bill decker

#bottomcontainerBox .buttons {
float:left;
height: 30px;
margin:4px 4px 4px 4px;
}

</style>
This is an interesting interview with Gonzalo Martinez, Director of Strategic Research in the office of the CTO at Autodesk. The significance of Autodesk is the fact that they are currently the largest company in the United States, and perhaps even the world that is producing a 3D printer. Earlier
item.content:encoded:
This is an interesting interview with Gonzalo Martinez, Director of Strategic Research in the office of the CTO at Autodesk.

The significance of Autodesk is the fact that they are currently the largest company in the United States, and perhaps even the world that is producing a 3D printer. Earlier this year the company, known for their C A D software, unveiled details on their upcoming SLA 3D printer, aimed towards consumers and small businesses. Why this matters, is that overnight the large 3D printing companies, suddenly found themselves competing with an enormous company (in some cases, more than twice as large as them). This will do two things in helping to spur on R&D into the space.
item.itunes:subtitle: This is an interesting interview with Gonzalo Martinez, Director of Strategic Research in the office of the CTO at Autodesk. The significance of Autodesk is the fact that they are currently the largest company in the United States, and perhaps even [...]
item.itunes:summary: This is an interesting interview with Gonzalo Martinez, Director of Strategic Research in the office of the CTO at Autodesk. The significance of Autodesk is the fact that they are currently the largest company in the United States, and perhaps even the world that is producing a 3D printer. Earlier this year the company, known for their C A D software, unveiled details on their upcoming SLA 3D printer, aimed towards consumers and small businesses. Why this matters, is that overnight the large 3D printing companies, suddenly found themselves competing with an enormous company (in some cases, more than twice as large as them). This will do two things in helping to spur on R&D into the space.
item.itunes:author: bill decker

Staples, once again is our guest on this “three peat” podcast. Here Chris Demeo, Vice President of Sales and Promotions at Staples speaks not only about Staples but also how small business in general can benefit from using 3D Printing. Chris does a great job of explaining Staples’ role and
item.content:encoded: Staples, once again is our guest on this “three peat” podcast. Here Chris Demeo, Vice President of Sales and Promotions at Staples speaks not only about Staples but also how small business in general can benefit from using 3D Printing. Chris does a great job of explaining Staples’ role and having fun at the same time. Enjoy!
item.itunes:subtitle: Staples, once again is our guest on this “three peat” podcast. Here Chris Demeo, Vice President of Sales and Promotions at Staples speaks not only about Staples but also how small business in general can benefit from using 3D Printing. C[...]
item.itunes:summary: Staples, once again is our guest on this “three peat” podcast. Here Chris Demeo, Vice President of Sales and Promotions at Staples speaks not only about Staples but also how small business in general can benefit from using 3D Printing. Chris does a great job of explaining Staples’ role and having fun at the same time. Enjoy!
item.itunes:author: bill decker

3D Printing Podcast interview with Ryan at Formlabs. We spoke to Ryan at the latest 3D Printing Conference about his firm’s 3D Printers and free software. This is a forward thinking company that has a lot to talk about as far as the 3D Printing Industry goes. Interesting 3D Printing
item.content:encoded:
3D Printing Podcast interview with Ryan at Formlabs. We spoke to Ryan at the latest 3D Printing Conference about his firm’s 3D Printers and free software. This is a forward thinking company that has a lot to talk about as far as the 3D Printing Industry goes.

Interesting 3D Printing Store idea, for sure

From the Formlabs site:
“That details matter when you design and engineer a product and that effort is wasted if it doesn’t improve the customer experience. That you should love working with your team. That people can manage their own schedule and get their work done. That work should be a passion, not a job.”

Subscribe to our newsletter at the Association of 3D Printing
item.itunes:subtitle: 3D Printing Podcast interview with Ryan at Formlabs. We spoke to Ryan at the latest 3D Printing Conference about his firm’s 3D Printers and free software. This is a forward thinking company that has a lot to talk about as far as the 3D Printin[...]
item.itunes:summary: 3D Printing Podcast interview with Ryan at Formlabs. We spoke to Ryan at the latest 3D Printing Conference about his firm’s 3D Printers and free software. This is a forward thinking company that has a lot to talk about as far as the 3D Printing Industry goes. Interesting 3D Printing Store idea, for sure From the Formlabs site: “That details matter when you design and engineer a product and that effort is wasted if it doesn’t improve the customer experience. That you should love working with your team. That people can manage their own schedule and get their work done. That work should be a passion, not a job.” Subscribe to our newsletter at the Association of 3D Printing
